dialogueLines: It started with something small, didn’t it?
You forgot something important to me — a memory, not a thing.
I said you weren’t listening… and maybe you weren’t.
The cup on the table fell and shattered between us.
That old coffee cup from our first café date, remember?
I watched it roll off the wooden table, taking our words with it.
The white light in the room felt colder than ever.
I didn’t shout. My voice was calm but cold.
You said nothing… silence hurts more than anger sometimes.
I dropped the spoon too — it clinked softly against the floor.
Our trust cracked that night, not just the cup.
The coffee smell still lingered, mixed with the sound of breaking glass.
I looked down at the cup, not at you.
I whispered ‘why’ under my breath, but you didn’t hear it.
I almost said sorry… but the words froze.
You stood still. Didn’t move. Didn’t say a word.
Even the rain outside went quiet after that sound.
The last sound before silence was the cup breaking.
Maybe the real problem wasn’t words… maybe it was silence.
Do you still remember how it felt, when everything broke?

questions.questionText: What caused the argument?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… you forgot something that mattered to me.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t a message. You forgot a memory.

questions.questionText: What fell during the argument?
questions.correctResponse: Right… that cup shattered between us.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it was the cup, not the phone.

questions.questionText: What kind of cup was it?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly… the same café cup from our first date.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it was the café cup, not a new one.

questions.questionText: What color was the room light?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… cold white. It made the room feel empty.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t warm. It was cold white.

questions.questionText: What was my tone when I spoke?
questions.correctResponse: Right. I wasn’t yelling — I was cold.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not loud. I said it quietly.

questions.questionText: What did you say after the cup fell?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… you said nothing. That silence said everything.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t say sorry that night.

questions.questionText: What fell with the cup?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly… the spoon hit the floor after it.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it was the spoon, not a frame.

questions.questionText: What broke that night besides the cup?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… our trust cracked that night.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t a lamp. It was trust.

questions.questionText: What smell filled the room?
questions.correctResponse: Right… the smell of coffee — the same as that café.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t dust. It was coffee.

questions.questionText: What was the table made of?
questions.correctResponse: Yes! The wooden table from the living room.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t glass. It was wood.

questions.questionText: What did I whisper before walking away?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly… I whispered 'why', but you didn’t hear me.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t say sorry. Just 'why'.

questions.questionText: What emotion did I feel after silence?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… hurt. Silence hurts more than words.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I wasn’t calm. I was hurting.

questions.questionText: What sound ended the moment?
questions.correctResponse: Right… the shatter was the last sound before silence.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not the door. It was the cup.

questions.questionText: What did the breaking sound mean to me?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… it meant the end of something precious.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t peace. It was an ending.

questions.questionText: What did I almost say but couldn’t?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… I almost said sorry, but the words froze.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t almost say goodbye.

questions.questionText: What did I look at before leaving?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly… I stared at the broken cup, not you.
questions.wrongResponse: No… not the window. The cup.

questions.questionText: What did you do as I turned away?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… you stayed silent. That silence said everything.
questions.wrongResponse: No… you didn’t call out. You stayed quiet.

questions.questionText: What did the silence feel like?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… heavy. Too heavy to breathe.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t peaceful. It was heavy.

questions.questionText: What did the moment teach me?
questions.correctResponse: Exactly. Silence hurts more than words ever could.
questions.wrongResponse: No… it wasn’t time heals. It was silence hurts.

questions.questionText: What was the last thing you saw me do?
questions.correctResponse: Yes… I turned away without a word.
questions.wrongResponse: No… I didn’t cry. I just turned away.
